trans-unit.source: Using castLabs to deliver DRM licenses to Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Using castLabs to deliver DRM licenses to Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: This article describes how you can use Azure Media Services (AMS) to deliver a stream that is dynamically encrypted by AMS with both PlayReady and Widevine DRMs. The PlayReady license comes from Media Services PlayReady license server and Widevine license is delivered by castLabs license server.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how you can use Azure Media Services (AMS) to deliver a stream that is dynamically encrypted by AMS with both PlayReady and Widevine DRMs. The PlayReady license comes from Media Services PlayReady license server and Widevine license is delivered by castLabs license server.

trans-unit.source: Using castLabs to deliver DRM licenses to Azure Media Services
trans-unit.target: Using castLabs to deliver DRM licenses to Azure Media Services

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article describes how you can use Azure Media Services (AMS) to deliver a stream that is dynamically encrypted by AMS with both PlayReady and Widevine DRMs.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how you can use Azure Media Services (AMS) to deliver a stream that is dynamically encrypted by AMS with both PlayReady and Widevine DRMs.

trans-unit.source: The PlayReady license comes from Media Services PlayReady license server and Widevine license is delivered by castLabs license server.
trans-unit.target: The PlayReady license comes from Media Services PlayReady license server and Widevine license is delivered by castLabs license server.

trans-unit.source: The following diagram demonstrates a high-level Azure Media Services and castLabs integration architecture.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram demonstrates a high-level Azure Media Services and castLabs integration architecture.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>integration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>integration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Typical system set up
trans-unit.target: Typical system set up

trans-unit.source: Media content is stored in AMS.
trans-unit.target: Media content is stored in AMS.

trans-unit.source: Key IDs of content keys are stored in both castLabs and AMS.
trans-unit.target: Key IDs of content keys are stored in both castLabs and AMS.

trans-unit.source: castLabs and AMS both have token authentication built in.
trans-unit.target: castLabs and AMS both have token authentication built in.

trans-unit.source: The following sections discuss authentication tokens.
trans-unit.target: The following sections discuss authentication tokens.

trans-unit.source: When a client requests to stream the video, the content is dynamically encrypted with Common Encryption (CENC) and dynamically packaged by AMS to Smooth Streaming and DASH.
trans-unit.target: When a client requests to stream the video, the content is dynamically encrypted with Common Encryption (CENC) and dynamically packaged by AMS to Smooth Streaming and DASH.

trans-unit.source: We also deliver PlayReady M2TS elementary stream encryption for HLS streaming protocol.
trans-unit.target: We also deliver PlayReady M2TS elementary stream encryption for HLS streaming protocol.

trans-unit.source: PlayReady license is retrieved from AMS license server and Widevine license is retrieved from castLabs license server.
trans-unit.target: PlayReady license is retrieved from AMS license server and Widevine license is retrieved from castLabs license server.

trans-unit.source: Media Player automatically decides which license to fetch based on the client platform capability.
trans-unit.target: Media Player automatically decides which license to fetch based on the client platform capability.

trans-unit.source: Authentication token generation for getting a license
trans-unit.target: Authentication token generation for getting a license

trans-unit.source: Both castLabs and AMS support JWT (JSON Web Token) token format used to authorize a license.
trans-unit.target: Both castLabs and AMS support JWT (JSON Web Token) token format used to authorize a license.

trans-unit.source: JWT token in AMS
trans-unit.target: JWT token in AMS

trans-unit.source: The following table describes JWT token in AMS.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes JWT token in AMS.

trans-unit.source: Issuer
trans-unit.target: Issuer

trans-unit.source: Issuer string from the chosen Secure Token Service (STS)
trans-unit.target: Issuer string from the chosen Secure Token Service (STS)

trans-unit.source: Audience
trans-unit.target: Audience

trans-unit.source: Audience string from the used STS
trans-unit.target: Audience string from the used STS

trans-unit.source: Claims
trans-unit.target: Claims

trans-unit.source: A set of claims
trans-unit.target: A set of claims

trans-unit.source: NotBefore
trans-unit.target: NotBefore

trans-unit.source: Start validity of the token
trans-unit.target: Start validity of the token

trans-unit.source: Expires
trans-unit.target: Expires

trans-unit.source: End validity of the token
trans-unit.target: End validity of the token

trans-unit.source: SigningCredentials
trans-unit.target: SigningCredentials

trans-unit.source: The key that is shared among PlayReady License Server, castLabs License Server and STS, it could be either symmetric or asymmetric key.
trans-unit.target: The key that is shared among PlayReady License Server, castLabs License Server and STS, it could be either symmetric or asymmetric key.

trans-unit.source: JWT token in castLabs
trans-unit.target: JWT token in castLabs

trans-unit.source: The following table describes JWT token in castLabs.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes JWT token in castLabs.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: optData
trans-unit.target: optData

trans-unit.source: A JSON string containing information about you.
trans-unit.target: A JSON string containing information about you.

trans-unit.source: crt
trans-unit.target: crt

trans-unit.source: A JSON string containing information about the asset, its license info and playback rights.
trans-unit.target: A JSON string containing information about the asset, its license info and playback rights.

trans-unit.source: iat
trans-unit.target: iat

trans-unit.source: The current datetime in epoch.
trans-unit.target: The current datetime in epoch.

trans-unit.source: jti
trans-unit.target: jti

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier about this token (every token can only be used once in the castLabs system).
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier about this token (every token can only be used once in the castLabs system).

trans-unit.source: Sample solution set up
trans-unit.target: Sample solution set up

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>sample solution</linkText><title></title></link> consists of two projects:
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>sample solution</linkText><title></title></link> consists of two projects:

trans-unit.source: A console app that can be used to set DRM restrictions on an already ingested asset, for both PlayReady and Widevine.
trans-unit.target: A console app that can be used to set DRM restrictions on an already ingested asset, for both PlayReady and Widevine.

trans-unit.source: A Web Application that hands out tokens, which could be seen as a VERY SIMPLIFIED version of an STS.
trans-unit.target: A Web Application that hands out tokens, which could be seen as a VERY SIMPLIFIED version of an STS.

trans-unit.source: To use the console application:
trans-unit.target: To use the console application:

trans-unit.source: Change the app.config to setup AMS credentials, castLabs credentials, STS configuration and shared key.
trans-unit.target: Change the app.config to setup AMS credentials, castLabs credentials, STS configuration and shared key.

trans-unit.source: Upload an Asset into AMS.
trans-unit.target: Upload an Asset into AMS.

trans-unit.source: Get the UUID from the uploaded Asset, and change Line 32 in the Program.cs file:
trans-unit.target: Get the UUID from the uploaded Asset, and change Line 32 in the Program.cs file:

trans-unit.source: Use an AssetId for naming the asset in the castLabs system (Line 44 in the Program.cs file).
trans-unit.target: Use an AssetId for naming the asset in the castLabs system (Line 44 in the Program.cs file).

trans-unit.source: You must set AssetId for castLabs; it needs to be a unique alphanumeric string.
trans-unit.target: You must set AssetId for castLabs; it needs to be a unique alphanumeric string.

trans-unit.source: Run the program.
trans-unit.target: Run the program.

trans-unit.source: To use the Web Application (STS):
trans-unit.target: To use the Web Application (STS):

trans-unit.source: Change the web.config to setup castlabs merchant ID, the STS configuration and the shared key.
trans-unit.target: Change the web.config to setup castlabs merchant ID, the STS configuration and the shared key.

trans-unit.source: Deploy to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Deploy to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the website.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the website.

trans-unit.source: Playing back a video
trans-unit.target: Playing back a video

trans-unit.source: To playback a video encrypted with common encryption (PlayReady), you can use the <link><linkText>Azure Media Player</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To playback a video encrypted with common encryption (PlayReady), you can use the <link><linkText>Azure Media Player</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When running the console app, the Content Key ID and the Manifest URL are echoed.
trans-unit.target: When running the console app, the Content Key ID and the Manifest URL are echoed.

trans-unit.source: Open a new tab and launch your STS: http://[yourStsName].azurewebsites.net/api/token/assetid/[yourCastLabsAssetId]/contentkeyid/[thecontentkeyid].
trans-unit.target: Open a new tab and launch your STS: http://[yourStsName].azurewebsites.net/api/token/assetid/[yourCastLabsAssetId]/contentkeyid/[thecontentkeyid].

trans-unit.source: Go to <link><linkText>Azure Media Player</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Go to <link><linkText>Azure Media Player</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Paste in the streaming URL.
trans-unit.target: Paste in the streaming URL.

trans-unit.source: Click the Advanced Options checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Click the Advanced Options checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Select PlayReady in the Protection dropdown.
trans-unit.target: Select PlayReady in the Protection dropdown.

trans-unit.source: Paste the token that you got from your STS in the Token textbox.
trans-unit.target: Paste the token that you got from your STS in the Token textbox.

trans-unit.source: Update the player.
trans-unit.target: Update the player.

trans-unit.source: The video should be playing.
trans-unit.target: The video should be playing.

trans-unit.source: For playing back the protected video in HTML5 with Chrome with the castLabs player, please contact yanmf@microsoft.com to get access to the player.
trans-unit.target: For playing back the protected video in HTML5 with Chrome with the castLabs player, please contact yanmf@microsoft.com to get access to the player.

trans-unit.source: When you have access, there are 2 things to be aware of:
trans-unit.target: When you have access, there are 2 things to be aware of:

trans-unit.source: The castLabs player needs access to the MPEG-DASH manifest file, so append (format=mpd-time-csf) to your manifest file to get the MPEG-DASH manifest file, instead of the default Smooth Streaming one.
trans-unit.target: The castLabs player needs access to the MPEG-DASH manifest file, so append (format=mpd-time-csf) to your manifest file to get the MPEG-DASH manifest file, instead of the default Smooth Streaming one.

trans-unit.source: The castLab license server does not need the “Bearer=” prefix in front of the token.
trans-unit.target: The castLab license server does not need the “Bearer=” prefix in front of the token.

trans-unit.source: So please remove that before submitting the token.
trans-unit.target: So please remove that before submitting the token.
